001package squidpony;
002
003import java.awt.AWTException;
004import java.awt.BorderLayout;
005import java.awt.Color;
006import java.awt.Dimension;
007import java.awt.FlowLayout;
008import java.awt.Graphics;
009import java.awt.Rectangle;
010import java.awt.Robot;
011import java.awt.event.MouseEvent;
012import java.util.TreeMap;
013import javax.swing.DefaultComboBoxModel;
014import javax.swing.Icon;
015import javax.swing.JComboBox;
016import javax.swing.JPanel;
017import javax.swing.JScrollPane;
018import javax.swing.JTextField;
019import javax.swing.Scrollable;
020import javax.swing.SwingConstants;
021import javax.swing.colorchooser.AbstractColorChooserPanel;
022import javax.swing.event.MouseInputListener;
023
024/**
025 * This class provides a way to interact with the pre-defined SColor constants
026 * in a Swing GUI.
027 *
028 * @author Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com
029 */
030public class SColorChooserPanel extends AbstractColorChooserPanel {
031
032    private SColor[] colors = SColor.FULL_PALLET;
033    private TreeMap<String, SColor[]> colorMap = new TreeMap<>();
034    private int colorHeight = 20;
035    private int colorWidth = 40;
036    private ColorPanel displayPanel = new ColorPanel();
037    private JScrollPane scrollPane = new JScrollPane();
038    private JComboBox colorComboBox = new JComboBox();
039    private JTextField colorName = new JTextField();
040    private boolean initialized = false;
041
042    @Override
043    public void updateChooser() {
044    }
045
046    @Override
047    protected void buildChooser() {
048
049        scrollPane.setViewportView(displayPanel);
050        displayPanel.addMouseListener(displayPanel);
051        displayPanel.addMouseMotionListener(displayPanel);
052        colorComboBox.addActionListener(new java.awt.event.ActionListener() {
053            @Override
054            public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {
055                colorComboBoxActionPerformed(evt);
056            }
057        });
058
059        colorMap.put("Achromatic Series", SColor.ACHROMATIC_SERIES);
060        colorMap.put("Blue Green Series", SColor.BLUE_GREEN_SERIES);
061        colorMap.put("Blue Violet Series", SColor.BLUE_VIOLET_SERIES);
062        colorMap.put("Full Pallet", SColor.FULL_PALLET);
063        colorMap.put("Rainbow", SColor.RAINBOW);
064        colorMap.put("Red Series", SColor.RED_SERIES);
065        colorMap.put("Red Violet Series", SColor.RED_VIOLET_SERIES);
066        colorMap.put("Violet Series", SColor.VIOLET_SERIES);
067        colorMap.put("Yellow Green Series", SColor.YELLOW_GREEN_SERIES);
068        colorMap.put("Yellow Red Series", SColor.YELLOW_RED_SERIES);
069        colorMap.put("Yellow Series", SColor.YELLOW_SERIES);
070
071        colorComboBox.setModel(new DefaultComboBoxModel(colorMap.keySet().toArray()));
072        setLayout(new BorderLayout());
073        add(colorComboBox, BorderLayout.NORTH);
074        add(scrollPane, BorderLayout.CENTER);
075        colorName.setEditable(false);
076        colorName.setHorizontalAlignment(JTextField.CENTER);
077        add(colorName, BorderLayout.SOUTH);
078
079        initialized = true;
080    }
081
082    private void refreshPanel() {
083        scrollPane.getViewport().setViewSize(displayPanel.getPreferredScrollableViewportSize());
084        scrollPane.getViewport().revalidate();
085        repaint();
086    }
087
088    private void colorComboBoxActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {
089        colors = colorMap.get((String) colorComboBox.getSelectedItem());
090        refreshPanel();
091    }
092
093    private void displayPanelMouseMoved(java.awt.event.MouseEvent evt) {
094        int index = evt.getY() / 20;
095        if (index < colors.length) {
096            String text = "";
097            switch (evt.getX() / colorWidth) {
098                case 0:
099                    text += "Fully Desaturated ";
100                    break;
101                case 1:
102                    text += "80% Desaturated ";
103                    break;
104                case 2:
105                    text += "Lightest ";
106                    break;
107                case 3:
108                    text += "Lighter ";
109                    break;
110                case 4:
111                    text += "Light ";
112                    break;
113                case 6:
114                    text += "Dim ";
115                    break;
116                case 7:
117                    text += "Dimmer ";
118                    break;
119                case 8:
120                    text += "Dimmest ";
121                    break;
122            }
123            text += colors[index].getName();
124//            displayPanel.setToolTipText(text);//don't need the tooltip with the display area
125            colorName.setText(text);
126        }
127    }
128
129    @Override
130    public String getDisplayName() {
131        return "SColor";
132    }
133
134    @Override
135    public Icon getSmallDisplayIcon() {
136        return null;
137    }
138
139    @Override
140    public Icon getLargeDisplayIcon() {
141        return null;
142    }
143
144    @Override
145    public void setBackground(Color bg) {
146        super.setBackground(bg);
147        if (initialized) {
148            displayPanel.setBackground(bg);
149            scrollPane.setBackground(bg);
150            colorComboBox.setBackground(bg);
151            colorName.setBackground(bg);
152        }
153    }
154
155    private class ColorPanel extends JPanel implements Scrollable, MouseInputListener {
156
157        ColorPanel() {
158            super(new FlowLayout());
159        }
160
161        @Override
162        public void setBackground(Color bg) {
163            super.setBackground(bg);
164        }
165
166        @Override
167        public Dimension getPreferredSize() {
168            return new Dimension(colorWidth * 9, colorHeight * colors.length);
169        }
170
171        @Override
172        public void paintComponent(Graphics g) {
173            super.paintComponent(g);
174            int x = 0;
175            int y = 0;
176
177            g.setColor(SColor.WHITE);
178            g.fillRect(0, 0, getWidth(), colorHeight);
179
180            for (int i = 0; i < colors.length; i++) {
181                SColor color = colors[i];
182
183                g.setColor(SColorFactory.desaturated(color));
184                g.fillRect(x, y, colorWidth, colorHeight);
185                x += colorWidth;
186
187                g.setColor(SColorFactory.desaturate(color, 0.8));
188                g.fillRect(x, y, colorWidth, colorHeight);
189                x += colorWidth;
190
191                g.setColor(SColorFactory.lightest(color));
192                g.fillRect(x, y, colorWidth, colorHeight);
193                x += colorWidth;
194
195                g.setColor(SColorFactory.lighter(color));
196                g.fillRect(x, y, colorWidth, colorHeight);
197                x += colorWidth;
198
199                g.setColor(SColorFactory.light(color));
200                g.fillRect(x, y, colorWidth, colorHeight);
201                x += colorWidth;
202
203                g.setColor(color);
204                g.fillRect(x, y, colorWidth, colorHeight);
205                x += colorWidth;
206
207                g.setColor(SColorFactory.dim(color));
208                g.fillRect(x, y, colorWidth, colorHeight);
209                x += colorWidth;
210
211                g.setColor(SColorFactory.dimmer(color));
212                g.fillRect(x, y, colorWidth, colorHeight);
213                x += colorWidth;
214
215                g.setColor(SColorFactory.dimmest(color));
216                g.fillRect(x, y, getWidth() - x, colorHeight);//last column fills out the rest of the space
217
218                x = 0;
219                y += colorHeight;
220            }
221        }
222
223        @Override
224        public Dimension getPreferredScrollableViewportSize() {
225            return new Dimension(colorWidth * 9, Math.min(400, colorHeight * colors.length));
226        }
227
228        @Override
229        public int getScrollableUnitIncrement(Rectangle rctngl, int i, int i1) {
230            if (i == SwingConstants.VERTICAL) {
231                return colorHeight;
232            } else {
233                return colorWidth;
234            }
235        }
236
237        @Override
238        public int getScrollableBlockIncrement(Rectangle rctngl, int i, int i1) {
239            if (i == SwingConstants.VERTICAL) {
240                return colorHeight * 5;
241            } else {
242                return colorWidth * 3;
243            }
244        }
245
246        @Override
247        public boolean getScrollableTracksViewportWidth() {
248            return false;
249        }
250
251        @Override
252        public boolean getScrollableTracksViewportHeight() {
253            return false;
254        }
255
256        @Override
257        public void mouseClicked(MouseEvent e) {
258            try {
259                Robot robot = new Robot();
260                getColorSelectionModel().setSelectedColor(robot.getPixelColor(e.getXOnScreen(), e.getYOnScreen()));
261            } catch (AWTException ex) {
262            }
263        }
264
265        @Override
266        public void mousePressed(MouseEvent e) {
267        }
268
269        @Override
270        public void mouseReleased(MouseEvent e) {
271        }
272
273        @Override
274        public void mouseEntered(MouseEvent e) {
275        }
276
277        @Override
278        public void mouseExited(MouseEvent e) {
279        }
280
281        @Override
282        public void mouseDragged(MouseEvent e) {
283        }
284
285        @Override
286        public void mouseMoved(MouseEvent e) {
287            displayPanelMouseMoved(e);
288        }
289    }
290}
